Art. 4.233. 
Gift of future property or contractual institution 
Any person may, in the matrimonial agreement of the spouses, dispose in favour of the said spouses or of one of them, of all or part of the property which he or she will leave on the day of his or her death.
In the same way, she may stipulate that the gift will benefit the joint children of the spouses, in the event that the donor survives the donee spouse.
Even if the gift has been made for the benefit of only one or both spouses, it is always, in the said case of the donor's survival, presumed to have been made for the benefit of the common children and descendants of these spouses.
The gift, in the form set out in paragraph 1, is irrevocable, only in the sense that the donor may no longer dispose, free of charge, of the objects included in the gift, except for modest sums, by way of reward or otherwise.
